Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice with part of cul; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky dark brown with added white bands at top and bottom of sherd; exterior: two dilute lines above junction with cul; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: A paper label is glued to the interior surface with the number 4 written in pencil, and it is also written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. The number 79 is written in pencil and crossed out on the exterior surface of the sherd. For parallels regarding the patterning, see Lemos no. 925 from Tocra.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0929) (phase 2)
